docs.snippet: The South Korean manufacturer is juggling safety problems with other goods, including washing machines, microwaves and refrigerators.

headline.print_headline: Galaxy Note 7 Not the Only Samsung Product Problem
headline.main: Galaxy Note 7 Is Not Samsung’s Only Problematic Product

docs.abstract: Samsung, which stopped making Galaxy Note 7 smartphones after they repeatedly caught fire, is enmeshed with other safety problems; has had to issue several other recalls over past few years, including ones for washing machines and microwave ovens.

docs.snippet: Her novel “Chanson Douce” is loosely based on the real-life killing of two children in New York while in the care of their nanny in 2012.

headline.main: Leïla Slimani Wins Prix Goncourt, France’s Top Literary Award

docs.abstract: French-Moroccan novelist Leila Slimani wins Prix Goncourt, France's top literary award, for novel Chanson Douce.

docs.snippet: The Israeli military on Tuesday demolished the family home of a Palestinian convicted of being an accomplice to a deadly attack on Israelis last year, while security was stepped up for a Jewish holiday that is set to begin at sundown.

docs.snippet: The ransacking took place on Sunday and Monday amid anger over a Facebook post that included an image of the Hindu god Shiva appearing at a Muslim holy site.

headline.print_headline: Muslims Attack Hindu Locations in East Bangladesh
headline.main: Hindu Temples and Homes in Bangladesh Are Attacked by Muslim Crowds

docs.abstract: Multiple crowds of Muslims attack Hindu homes and temples in eastern Bangladesh, sparking concerns that authorities are doing little to address rising sectarian tensions.

docs.snippet: A shark attacked a surfer north of Cannon Beach off the Oregon coast. But he survived after swimming to shore and instructing others how to tie a tourniquet around his injured leg, police said.

headline.print_headline: Police: Shark Attacks Surfer Off Oregon Coast
headline.main: Police: Shark Attacks Surfer Off Oregon Coast
